Description: Pottery ostracon containing a literary text on the front and a religious text on the back, written in Coptic.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Sheikh Abd el-Qurna (Thebes), Monastery of Epiphanius, see curator's comments.
Curator's comments: Said to be from Karnak, O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 21.1 physically joins O.Mon.Epiph. 16A, which the 1913/1914 MMA Expedition was discovered in Cell A (MMA 806) of the Monastery of Epiphanius.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.28-29, pl.21)
von Lemm 1908 / Koptische Miscellen LI-LXI (p.1337-39, no.7)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (108525) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/108525)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 21:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
